column13: Great food and great service. The brunch menu options were diverse and delicious.

Had a lovely evening...would prefer first floor with fireplace rather than third floor. Our service was outstanding......food not great ( hubby not crazy about his strip steak) although my son had duck and escargot ( appetizer) and enjoyed both.
Booked this for 2 during restaurant week and wasn't sure what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised!! Recommend the crab beignets!!

The server we had (Guillium) was very rude and unprofessional. It took forever to take our order and the way he spoke was like he was yelling at us and he rushed us as we ordered. We put in our order and it took 1 hour to get our soup and salad. The entrees took another 20 minutes. The food was fine not great just fine. We wanted desert but didn't want to spend another minute at the table so we asked for it to go and our waiter told us no. We didn't want ice cream just a piece of cake and he told me he couldn't make it to go. HUH? I guess putting it in a box was a hassle for him. I told the manager about how long the wait was for appetizers and how rude the waiter was and she just nodded her head and said sorry and that was it! Never again.
We loved it. Excellent food and a most interesting wine list.

column4: 2941 Fairview Park Drive Falls Church, VA  22042
column13: The food , service and ambeince were excellent. There needs to be a sign in the parking garage that directs customers to the valet parking at the lane exiting the garage.
My companion was unable to make it for lunch, so I had lunch at the bar.The barman was very professional and rendered excelent service.
Love love love this place every time! We have enjoyed dinners, drinks, lunch, Sunday brunch- 8407 does it all so well. So lucky to have 8407 here in Silver Spring!

We had an excellent experience at A La Lucia. Food was excellent, service was outstanding, and the restaurant was very helpful in placing the flowers I had delivered on our table before arrival. I would highly recommend A La Lucia to any diners looking for an excellent dining experience.

First time dining here and was really pleased. The food was excellent and the portion sizes were more than expected. We had crab cakes and filet mignon which we shared and got the best of both. ....all I can say is that this was to die for! We will definitely come back again.

Restaurant week features scaled back items from regular menu -- and very limited options. Ambiance was like a Baskin and Robins ice cream shop. Service was poor: one waiter for the entire area. I've been told that al fresco dining is lovely there. The interior is not.

Best Italian food that I have had in DC. I'm from New York and we know good Italian-this is it. And their specials make everything affordable. They were also very accomodating to us bringing my 2 month old. Excellent place-we will be back!
The service was pretty bad. The waitress kept going over to talk to her friend.

I wish I coudl handle hot food, because my husband's smelled amazing. He tells me it was delicious as well. I went more mild with salmon, and it was beautifully cooked and had a delicous side. A little cold up front, but service was excellent and staff was very friendly and courteous.

column1: Adour at St. Regis Washington DC
column13: I used to really enjoy this restaurant, but the service has declined considerably the last two times I have been there.
Great food, Great service, Tables were positioned very close together making a private conversation impossible. Overall a very good dining experience and would recommend!

column4: 3201 New Mexico Ave. Suite E NW Washington, DC  20016
column13: The food was absolutely delicious. The polenta is a must-try for anybody that wants to see it done exquisitely! The brunch fix prix was excellent in terms of serving size and fabulous food for an extremely reasonable price!

This was our sixth visit to the restaurant and all six have been very enjoyable. It is a family owned and run restaurant and the special touches are appreciated from the unique silverware to the hand made and painted espresso cups. The food is quite good and the menu for a small restaurant is representative. The deserts are 'homemade' and worth the extra calories.
The Dover Sole was excellent -and has been a draw for us

This is our third time here and for some reason, every time we come we feel like the food gets better every time. We absolutely loved our Carne Asada and Chimichurri Beef. So flavorful and juicy! Even though we were full, we still kept eating because we didn't want to waste it. So delicious! Our 8 year old daughter ate her food and then proceeded to eat ours. She couldn't get enough of the tender, well-seasoned beef. Margaritas were great and our dinner bill didn't break the bank. We are definitely coming back very soon. Not sure how it can get better than our last experience.

Great food, really. Very fast and courteous service. Family owned for 36 years. Highly recommend. after only one visit. That said, not in a great part of town, and not very picturesque but still, the food and family make all that go away.Go!

I loved the ambiance and location in relation to the metro. The food was good; especially the butternut squash salad and the mushroom crepes (yum!!!). Everyone raved about the fried sourdough and I was so excited when I ordered it, however it was not pan fried, rather battered and deep fried and felt a lot like carnival food. Beware though that the food is very rich and a lot of dishes have cheese and/or are fried.

This place is simply awesome! My wife and I had lunch at the Tap room and we highly recommend this place. We love the laid-back feel of this place - chic, cozy and a smooth atmosphere – like being in a snow mountain cabin restaurant. The chicken and waffles are my favorite. *****
good food...big portions...good service...nice ambiance.
Went for brunch. Food was good, but except for the deep fried deviled eggs (which were really yummy), the rest of the food was just fine, but nothing special or notable.

We live in the neighborhood of Amici Miei and have eaten there many, many times. The food has always been very good and they try to add a little extra to make it taste in more special. We would recommend it.

Annie's is not quite a French bistro. The food was decidedly average. The duck breast was passable. The French Onion Soup was not that authentic and had way too much cheese on top. I had merguez sausages that looked like third rate breakfast sausage and tasted only marginally better. But nice ambience and service was attentive and friendly. The high point was the dessert: a brownie a la mode with berry compote. Not exactly French but certainly tasty.

My brunch BLT on brioche with a sundried tomato chutney, bacon, and a fried egg was scrumptious! The rest of the menu was intriguing and our server helpful with our questions and choices. Staff was very accommodating to our small group, all arriving with suitcases in hand, and immediately storing them away.
I work nearby and Aria is a dependable standby for lunch. Very good pizza, pasta, soups, sandwiches, and salad. Staff is very friendly and service is generally quick.

Rooftop would have received a better overall grade, but the service was really slow. Our server paid more attention to friends (who arrived 15 minutes after us, ensure they got a table, and served them drinks before any water or our drink order which was place earlier).

column4: 415 New Jersey Avenue NW Washington, DC  20001
column13: Dined at Art and Soul for Sunday brunch. We got there pretty early with tables open and it quickly got packed! The food was outstanding with lots of great choices from the typical buffet fare to individually made omelettes, waffles and a meat station. The fruite and cheese trays were a nice bonus. I think we were unlucky with our waitress as she wasn't very friendly or attentive. But it did not seem indicative of the entire restaurant. I think we just got someone on a bad day. Overall great experience. Would like to go back for lunch or dinner to see if the mood changes.

column4: 400 New Jersey Avenue, NW Washington, DC  20001
column13: perfect private room for a table of 8 people. Food is good though a little expensive for a hotel restaurant. It's a little loud since it's in the lobby of the hotel.
Its hard to overlook the fact that the food was bland with little seasoning. The bread basket was our salvation!
We were met at the door as we entered from the parking lot. We brought a special bottle of wine which needed decanting. Neal, the sommelier, handled everything in a most professional manner.
Good choice in Penn Quarter. Of the Asian choices in the area the best combination of a wide variety of pan Asian menu choices, food quality and price.

We loved this small and intimate oasis in the hustle and bustle of Gallery Place. What a treasure to find this lovely restaurant with great service and delicious food selections just steps from the Verizon Center! I think this will be our new "go to" spot whenever we are at the Verizon Center for a game or a show. It doesn't matter whether you like sushi or pud thai, this place is "everything asian." We loved the duck, and the asian beef appetizer was flavorful and fresh. For a real treat, try the ginger-flavored drink.

this is an amazing italian restaurant...Menu has so many choise and they offer amazing daily special..we had the mozzarella which was just fantastic served with varius choice and a superb green tomato jam...the serve explained us that they were serving grilled whole branzino at a very reasonable price so we decided to go for it and it was totally worth he also suggested an amazing bottle of wine wich matched ours budget..dessert menu in nice simple but with a stravagante touch ...we had an amazing experience and we will surely go backFood and great service made it such a great night
First time there. Expecting a quiet, romantic dinner but tables too close to each other and noise so loud had to shout to be heard. Would not choose for a romantic dinner place or special occasion.

column1: Avenue Cafe Bar and Grill-Holiday Inn Central
column4: 1501 Rhode Island Avenue NW Washington, DC  20005
column13: Very happy with the service, menu, and food. Great place to eat that you might just miss. I highly recommend stopping in for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I had both breakfast and dinner there during my stay at the hotel and I was not disappointed.

About what you would expect for a hotel restaurant. Expensive but passable quality. Some dishes over salted by my taste, but might be fine for others. Children's hamburger was pretty bad though, very dry. Daughter took two bites and even with the enticement of dessert, wouldn't eat any more. Portions were all huge.
The food was so good that it made me wanna slap my momma!
This place has awesome food. They offered a prix menu that catered to all.
A delightful place where diners are warmly welcomed. Food was excellent.
Solid spot. Very well prepared meats in a well worn New Orleans ambiance.
Great staff and the food was excellent. Highly recommend Bazin's.

column4: 1615 Rhode Island Ave. NW Washington, DC  20036
column13: I love brunch at the Beacon, especially with girls. We really enjoy ourselves everytime we go.
Nice Sunday lunch in a very lively restaurant. Good for the young crowd. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.

Reserved table for Valentine's Day Evening at 6 pm. Restaurant is very small...cafe like with tables for two and four huddled together around the room. Regarding the menu...we were surprised that it was limited compared to what you view on their website...No mussels appetizer...more importantly and disappointingly...no beef entry of any kind...No wine list either....The pasta with sausage was good. The linguine capreassi I had was ok. The scallops were bland and the lobster was soggy as if it had been boiled over long. The service was ok. The ambience is nice enough but not spectacular, although with the tables so close together the noise level was certainly energetic.
We had a wonderful birthday celebration for my son. Great food and great service.
Entertaining to watch the cook, and the service was good.
Great restaurant, great location.
Overall satisfaction at any time!!

We came into town and decided to make reservations based on past reviews. It was great! The service was top notch. I always have a peeve with the servers not refilling your water etc. This place was on top of everything. We didnt feel rushed. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was beautiful. Thanks for a great experience.

Cooking is superior (although the "frisee salad with lardons" was just OK and the food generally arrived lukewarm) but the service is awful. The waiter, Michael was apologetic from the start even before we started to complain! Our Bordeaux was way to cool because the bottle had been stored in the wrong place, he said. It took him over 15 minutes to come and take our orders, etc... Close to 2 hours had elapsed as we finished our appetizers and entrees. By then we were angry and skipped dessert. What a poor venue to celebrate my wife's birthday! Very noisy place and "cafe du commerce" ambiance! I did mention our Open Table reservation on arrival apparently to no avail. The feedback form has yet to reach us 3 days later...
My partner and I had a delighful Valentine's day Dinner. Food was outstanding, ambiance romantic and service was suburb.

We took a friend with us to have her experience this neighborhood restaurant. She's a vegitarian and found things that she could eat, such as the mushroom risotto and the potato chips. The waitress was able to answer some questions about the food prep and the manager(?) who was sitting and working on something nearby was able to answer what she couldn't. We had a quieter meal than normal as we were seated in the area that during the day is the coffee shop, away from the louder bar area. Good time was had by all.
The food temperatures varied and when our waiter came by to ask how our food was he didn't even stay long enough to hear our answers.
Very pleasant experience, will definitely recommend to my friends and family. My wife and I also plan to return. Food was incredible, service was great.

Bistrot Lepic was perfect for a date night. Small, soft lighting, with a warm feel. The duck was wonderful and I'd love to go back and try other things on their menu. Service was attentive without being intrusive. Definitely recommend!
I was very impressed with the décor. The location is great – next door to a parking garage. It is beautifully decorated; the food and the service were terrific.
Fantastic as always! Best seafood in the District.
Food is very good overall, but my recent lobster roll had more mayo - too much - than usual. Service is hit or miss - servers very attentive to certain clientele, inattentive to others.

Loved it despite the loud and ungracious group seated in the private dining room.I realize that it was a celebration but for Pete's sake keep the hooting and hollering down. They could be heard all over the restaurant. There is no need to yell. Otherwise loved the food and the mimosas, the desserts were outstanding and service was prompt and courteous. The restaurant is very well designed- loved it all.

column1: Bobby Van's Grill - New York Ave.
column4: 1201 New York Avenue, NW Washington, DC  20005
column13: The food was great, and the atmosphere was vibrant and we felt like we were having dinner with a bunch of friends. Although they were busy but we got served fairly quickly. we recommend highly.
We have been to Bobby Vans four times now. Every visit has been excellent with super service. This is becoming our hangout
Romantic, great food. Just a little too boisterously noisy and crowded for five stars.
Very gracious waitstaff, nice interior. Food was good but portions on the small side.
Fennel Salad was absolutely amazing!

My wife and I have been here several times and couldn't be happier to have this restaurant in our neighborhood. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, the food and drinks are great, and the atmosphere is great for our date nights. We highly recommend it!
Just a basic bar. Food was average but cold.

column1: BRABO by Robert Wiedmaier - Lorien Hotel & Spa
column13: The food was amazing and our server (Devon) was exceptionally knowledgeable. Brabo is a higher end dining experience in a casual setting. I look forward to returning for special occasions.
This is a really nice place for a date or drinks after work. It always feels lively but not over crowded and the food (especially the mussels) is excellent.
Small with very intimate seating (European style) where your guests on either side are pretty much part of your conversation
Loved the wine list. Service excellent. Food was great. Think it would be more romantic if they used table linens, dimmed the lights, and added candles to the tables. But, still a great place.
Always a great amount of delicious food. Very relaxing time.
The wait staff at this Buca location always is topnotch. They go out of their way to be pleasant and efficient. The food never fails to deliver. It was a great time.

I was excited about eating here because I had heard the scallops were delicious. When we arrived for our 6:30 reservation, we waited 10 minutes for a hostess to ever show up to seat us. No one was at the front desk. Once seated, on what I'd call the "fish camp" side, it took another 10 minutes to be approached by a waiter who acted as if we were an afterthought. His question, "has anyone helped you yet?" We decided to go ahead and order, thinking we may not get another chance. I had the French Onion Soup. Taste was good, but there was almost no broth. All onions. Ordered scallops to be told they were "out." Changed to roasted chicken which was just okay. Food was delivered quickly, but refills on drinks were slow to come.
The food here was mediocre, nothing to write home about, but it was decently priced and the service was outstanding.

We went back to Cafe Berlin after many years of absence from DC to find that quality of food remains as good as it always was. It was quite a rewarding experience! While the decor has not change either and thus, is a bit dated, Cafe Berlin remains probably the best place in DC for good German food. And the beer? Invariably, wonderful seasonal selections of wonderful German beer. I like this restaurant a lot!

While the food was wonderful and the server delightful as well as attentive, I was deeply disappointed in my dining experience at Cafe du Parc yesterday. The heat did not appear to be on in the upstairs dining room. Several patrons, including myself, were forced to keep on their overcoats and scarfs. It was not only chilly but unpleasant. We were told by the server that it had been like that for several weeks and he has fielded many complaints. We finished our meal before dessert and coffee because it was too much for my older dining companion to handle any longer.
Loved the homemade Italian food and the personality of the waitress!

The food was good, especially the crispy spinach. One area for improvement: I took two of the dishes and a side home. They put it all in a styrofoam plate. the dishes bled into each other. When they have saucy food like that a covered container would be much better.

Delicious food, pasta main course was not very large.Waitress wasn't very knowledgeable, even brought the wrong wine in the beginning and didn't provide answers to the questions, possibly because she was new? Maitre D' on the other hand was outstanding and friendly.
The food was great and the right amount of variety for a special occasion.
My husband and I visited last night for Valentines Day... The food was excellent as were the service provided.
We have eaten here many times and always enjoy it. We tried the plates menu which was absolutely fantastic. The service was great as always.
Always good food, well prepared. Service is first rate. Restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere - good for a business lunch.
Always great steaks and great service! We always use this occasion as a way of thanking our members for their work on our behalf in Washington, DC.

column4: 1100 New York Ave. N.W. Washington, DC  20005
column13: We went there on a Sat night in early February, group of 7; we were placed on the second floor, which had its pros and cons - it was far less noisy than downstairs, but lacked completely in ambiance. Service, however, was good, food was decent, and prices quite ok, so recommendable overall.
The food wasn't bad, but wasn't good. The ambiance wasn't terrible, but wasn't terrific. Over all our whole experience was so-so
Great cocktails! Reasonable wine.

We went to Carlyle Club during Alexandria restaurant week so I have no comparison to other nights. But the service was great and the love jazz band added a wonderful vibe. The food was very good, standard fare, nothing incredibly out of the ordinary. I had the lobster bisque with field mignon and cheesecake for dessert. The steak was cooked more rare than medium rare but overall was a great cut of meet. The cheesecake was very tasty and included a strawberry sauce. Overall it was a very enjoyable evening and I'd definitely recommend for a special occasion or nice dinner out.

Worthy examples of Oaxacan regional cuisine. Tres Moles, dark, green and red moles on chicken, is a great dish for mole pros and first-timers. Upgrade your Margaritas, the house level was a little too sweet, weak on the tequila. Service was fun and fast. The restaurant failed to credit our Open Table reservation, but a follow up email from Open Table cleared the problem.
Great food and an always interesting menu that changes frequently. It gets a little loud. The service can be slow.
Great food and excellent, decor and service.

Service is attentive and reasonably quick, though the place was not crowded when my wife and I visited for dinner a couple of nights before New Year's eve. The food is fairly good -- not the best Thai I have eaten (the Num Tok was nicely spicy but a bit dry, the soft rolls looked more succulent than the crispy rolls we ordered, and next time I'll ask for the red curry instead of the Mussaman, which lacked typical Thai subtlety). The wine and beer list is probably not long enough to be called "notable", but the selections are well thought-out, especially the beer list which included three quality craft brews. Overall, the experience is worth trying if you're desperate for Thai eating in Fairfax, Va.

column4: 7401 Woodmont Avenue @ 2 Bethesda Metro Center Bethesda, MD  20814
column13: The food was good, but overpriced for the quality. The service was very slow and not very good.

On the day of the reservation, we were running a bit late due to traffic. We called the restaurant and they graciously said "not a problem, we will hold the table for you." That was just the beginning of a great night. We actually arrived just in time and the first thing that struck me was the nicely lit dining area and the handsome wine cellar that they have. We were seated promptly and took a second to look over the menu. Our waiter came around often and answered all our questions we had about the menu. When we ordered we asked for one of the sides as a sort of appetizer and the waiter said it was not a problem. Throughout the night, our waiter was exemplary in every facet. The food was delicious and hot when we got it.
Awesome place to take a date or have a romantic evening out.

Waiter was inexperienced; didn't know how to pronounce beignets, even though it was supposedly a Cajun-themed restaurant. He did offer the bib for the lobster eater but offered no help in how to eat it. Salad was wilted but the fish portion was good. I had the Cajun dressing and requested a second helping and was delivered ranch dressing. Oh well!
This place just never gets old. Food is fresh and delicious and the menu changes th reflect seasonal specialties.
Chef Geoff's has become our favorite restaurant downtown and as always, we were ot disappointed this past Saturday. Every aspect was simply great.

I went to Chef Geoff's in Rockville for the first time for a special occasion. The service we experienced was the best I have had in years. The food was tasty and interesting. The menu has something for everyone. I cant wait for the next special occasion to go back.
We went to Chef Geoff's for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful evening. The food was superb--the gnocchi w/duck confit was out of this world! Plan to come back for more...
Great food! Was very impressed.
Love this place! Signatures cocktails are amazing. Dessert also awesome!

Loved the food, drinks and wine. Did not like the TVs on the restaurant showing "Alegria". Maybe it should be reserved for a part of the restaurant where people want to watch it. However, it can be very distracting when it can be seen everywhere. Took away the sense to "go out and eat and not be home in front of the TV".
It seems that we went in the wrong day as we were the only ones there...but the place is very very good, and I recommend it. The food and the service ara excellent.
Better place for the drinks, not the food

From the moment we walked in until the moment we left, it was a terrific experience. We were greeted at the front door by one of the owners I believe and taken to our table. Linda, our server, was so friendly and took the time to make suggestions and answer any questions we had. All of our food was incredible and we will definitely be back!
They do everything exceptionally well. Staff is remarkably attentive and their is complete flexibility in modifying menu to meet guests needs.
Food was outstanding. We enjoyed the atmosphere.
One of our favorite spots for dining with friends.

i always come back to this place...i think that of all the hundreds of times i have been here , that there has only been about 5 times i had a mishap or bad food or service incident...so the odds are not bad...big groups, single dinner, spur of the moment family dinner...they accommodate.
The meal was aweesome and I liked being greeted at the door. Made me feel like I was company and expected. I was also pleased that our table was ready and we were seated and served immediately.
Thought it was a great place. The tables were a little close in one particular section but the food was yummy and our server was GREAT!
Clyde's never dissapoints. A great mix of laid back, fancy and solid comfort food. Our go to place for fun dinners out.
Excellent! A superb dining experience in a cozy bistro environment.

Great food with great service.. We were never rushed and the food and wine came out at the right time. The strolling violinist was an extra special touch. We do not go out much, but when we do, we want to make it special... Clyde's did that for us!
Wonderful food and ambiance. They took it to the next level with decor and service. Will definitely go back when in the area.

column4: 109 South St. Asaph St. Alexandria, VA  22314
column13: We were pleasantly surprised with the decor, food and service. Oysters were great. I was told by someone in my group that the Bison Strogonof was amazing.I would go back...

It was good but disappointing, or average. Food was under flavored, they sat a 5 top next to us which made it so I couldnt get out as the chair rested against our table, The service was outstanding --- It seems to me that the kitchen lost it passion for flavor nad food. It was like being at an Applebee's

column1: The Comus Inn at Sugarloaf Mountain
column13: The Comus Inn is a delightful place to have a delicious, quiet dinner with friends. If you are there before sunset, you will be treated to a beautiful view. The food was absolutely delicious. The flatiron steak had a marvelous flavor, and the sea scallops were to die for. I recommend the historic Comus Inn.

Food was not great. Our guests barely ate their food. It was quiet and our server was not personable or helpful. He would disappear at length and when we asked about the menu selections, he appeared completely disinterested.
Although the food was very good, the price was not worth the experience.
Excellent cuisine and superb service! This place is great!
No is very good restaurant and it isn't have a good food
Great food and outstanding service. The staff went out of its way to make our visit enjoyable. Very accommodating staff at this restaurant.
A very friendly restaurant that strives to satify every time. The weekend music is a lot of fun and great for groups and vegitarians.

Totally in awe of this restaurant. I wanted to try a new place out and remembered a friend recommended it awhile back. This place is truly a hidden gem with its simple outside yet filled with a lavish and flavorful dining experience.

column1: The Daily Dish, A Restaurant & Catering Company
column13: We went there for Valentine's Day and the meal was very nice/the service was excellent. The ambiance isn't great because they dont' have much room. We were squeezed next to a lot of other people so it wasn't very romantic. I'm sure it would be perfect for lunch or brunch sometime.

I do not believe I have ever had better restaurant service than by Scott (I'm 44). The man not only does his job with excellence, but he has a generous spirit and makes you feel taken care of with his thoughtfulness both about the menu and in his offering of samples when a particular item of a dish was in question (e.g. a type of mushrooms I do not recall having before). Beer was taste tested/enjoyed, bread warm, appetizers of crab cake and scallops were excellent, chicken meatballs in the pasta very flavorful, my guest enjoyed his pork chop entree and we shared a delicious key lime pie. We were so comfortable and treated so well we had a nearly 3 hour dinner. I will be returning and asking for Scott. Happier than a tall dog in a meat shop!

Stopped going there for lunch because of the noise - tables too close together and overall noise level awful. Stopped in for fairly late dinner and hoped it would be better. Thought the banquette on the side would help. No such luck. Spent an hour not quite hearing my table companions and reluctant to scream and add to the din.Too bad - the food & wine were quite good and the server was terrific.Ambiance isn't about how pretty the restaurant is - Daily Grill is very nice to look at - it is about the dining experience. When you hear as much from the birthday celebration in the middle of the room as you do from your partners in the banquette, you lose something important.
Great food. Excellent service. The 3 piece jazz band was a welcomed surprise. Wanted fish and there were many choices.

We were told that the Dancing Crab recently changed management/ownership and has been refurbished and there is a new menu. Food is well and simply prepared. Crab cakes and oysters were delicious. Fellow diners praised the clam chowder and lobster; lots of bones in the fish but good flavor. Coffee (at least the decaf) was not very good. Local crabs are not in season and the only ones available were small so we did not try those. Homey neighborhood atmosphere. Large TVs showed the football playoff games but without sound. Attentive, helpful, prompt service. The website is way out of date (referred to Hechingers as a nearby store) and is still owned by by prior owners/ management but changes are reportedly in the works.
It was my first time at Dante. It was a great experience.

The food and service were good but the tables were crammed in so close together that it felt awkward. Enough so that this alone really colored the whole experience. I'd recommend this place if you could get a decently separate table, otherwise skip it.
The fried oysters were memorable and the fish and chips were also great.
Good food, a bit "hectic" with lots of background noise.

A new take on Jewish cooking ... bringing it into the 21st century. Nothing industrial, all meats, pickles, fish brined, smoked and cured in-house. Dinner menu is a gem: flanken [short ribs] perfectly braised with figs, chopped liver divine. Shishlik [mahi-mahi on skewers with couscous] light but with mouth-filling flavor. And, of course, there's the pastrami and corned beef. Wow!
...the ways.

Food was very bland. Macaroni truffle was like soup. Great arugula salad and tasty ice cream hearts. Bread was awesome. My wife's fish was bland and my sift and turf was nothing special. Tasted like they didn't use spices or any seasoning. Ambiance was great but the food was very lacking. Our waiter was very nice but we didn't feel like it should have taken as long as it did to get our food... There were definite lulls between entrees. Was alright, probably wouldn't go back.

DISH+Drinks at the River Inn is a fantastic neighborhood find. My girlfriend and I go there all the time and consistently get great service, good food and an overall enjoyable experience. Keith, the manager, is awesome.
Consistent good food and service.

If you're visiting in the winter, be prepared for the restaurant to be cold. The Mexican meatballs and desserts were good, though the pork chop was mediocre. It was also disappointing that the online menu was not the menu we were offered onsite. Our group had all chosen dishes to order that were no longer on the menu. I had expected more variety to choose from for the entrees. Overall it was ok, but I probably would have chosen somewhere else to visit for Restaurant Week.

We dined with some friends that we hadn't seen in some time. Diya, though a large restaurant, was the perfect choice—staff was most accommodating and did an excellent job answering questions regarding the various Indian dishes. One of our party had a gluten intolerance, one could not eat spinach, and one was a carnivore. Diya served us all. The food was very good and the pricing was reasonable. Would definitely go back again.

Service was excellent - very polite and always helpfull waiter. Foos was OK, but the steak for lunch was super thin - it was flavorful, but had a lot of fat. Rice accompanying the steak was good but very dry.
We went here for dinner and it was definitely a good find! The food was good and the staff was really kind! definitely would go back again!

column4: 5 Olney Sandy Spring Road Ashton, MD  20861
column13: Food used to be quite good now average. Service, especially on Sundays is lackluster, servers are either inexperienced or disinterested, staff seem less engaged.

Awesome, awesome bottomless brunch. The drinks were amazing, as was the food. Our waiter was attentive, although since we were a large group (7 people) he decided that he would just send out food rather than us order... While that was somewhat annoying, he definitely didn't let us down with the food he sent out. I'd come back here for brunch anytime!

column4: 12050 A North Shore Drive Reston, VA  20190
column13: I took my wife there for Valintine Day. It was very busy and the sevice was awesome also everyone made us feel like we were the only ones that mattered making it a wonderful experience. I will be bringing my wife and friends there in the future.

The food's great and seems authentic since most of the restaurant seems to be Argentinian folk. My husband had steak which was so tender and juicy and perfectly seasoned. My shrimp and veg kabob was also very tasty and perfectly cooked. The live music was a bit loud for allowing conversation, but it made the atmosphere very lively and fun. A great pseudo-vacation -- full of life Argentina in dull Rockville, who would have ever guessed?
El Tamarindo is a great new restaurant in Adam's Morgan. It's very authentic Mexican and Salvadorian food and my husband and I enjoyed our time there. Mojitos were great too!
Although this was a very quiet night, it was very good service and the food was yummy.
We keep coming back because the food is exceptional and the service is the best in DC. Highly recommended!

From the moment we arrived (6 pm) we were spoiled with attention. All our questions on the townhouse building, the artwork, and the cuisine were answered politely and completely. The wine complemented each course and all the food was extremely flavorful.

Epic Smokehouse was a great meal for a decent price. The waiter was smart and friendly, while the food was very good. Our meal came out cold but it was corrected quickly and the waiter got us a free round which kept us happy.

Equinox had been on my to-do list for quite some time, and I may have mistimed it by missing it at its peak. While lovely ambiance and excellent service, the food was not at a high enough level to warrant the expense or the hype. The truffled rice fritters might have been in the same room as a truffle once, but you wouldn't be able to tell by the flavor. For the price range, there are better options out there. Still, not a bad option if you want a quiet, classy place for an intimate dinner downtown.
Incredible food, go with a group so you can sample as many things as possible.
Food was great! Higher price than some other Ethiopian restaurants, but on par with the busier ones. The carrots and string bean dish was really tasty and something I haven't seen elsewhere.
Jim Jeffords is a very talented chef!

The hostess didn't acknowledge me for 10 minutes while she was on the phone; the rolls were cold and hard and not very tasty. My husband's Caesar salad was nothing special. My beet/goat cheese fondue salad was excellent. We both ordered the New York Strips w/ truffle. I found it to be delicious. My husband said it was so-so. I ordered the pina colada flan. The pineapple was ok, but the flan part was the perfect consistency, and I'm really picky when it comes to flan. All in all, ok, but I'm not rushing to go back.

column4: 1313 Old Chain Bridge Rd McLean, VA  22101
column13: Service was fair to poor--way too much time in between courses, especially after the main course, it took about 15-20 minutes to get desserts (we ordered from the fixed menu so I don't understand why it would take so long). My friend ordered a second drink, which never even came. There seems to be this "team" approach to wait staff, so we had at least 3 wait personnel for our table, but each of them ignored us sufficiently, that I was beginning to wonder whether maybe they had added another waiter to the team. It was DC Restaurant Week and we went with the fixed menu, the place was busy, but I would expect way better service for the prices they charge. Food was OK, but I would probably only return for the half price happy hour.

Restaurant has a hip swanky vibe and is located in trendy Shirlington. We had 8 for Sunday Brunch. Brunch menu had a great variety and for the most part was reasonably priced (avg $10). The Wood Fired Eggs were slightly overcooked and a side of bacon was $4 for two pieces (a little pricey). Friends had the Florentine Omelet, Egg & Potato Casserole, and Rustic Deep Dish Quiche and said they were fantastic. Husband had the St. Benedictine and although good, thought it was a little stingy on the hollandaise. Restaurant was quiet (despite being almost full) so we were able to carry on a conversation. Wait staff was professional and provided great service. This will be my Sunday Brunch place as it also works for an intimate brunch for two

Great food--whether you think you like Turkish or not. Get 4-5 dishes per person and share. The cooking style is pure and means you won't full stuffed--just full. The wine list is outstanding and has lots of selections by the glass and half-glass that make it ideal for pairing. I will go back soon.
Great family-friendly spot by Volt's Brian Voltaggio. Odd location (across from a Dollar Store) but cool locale, friendly staff, and delicious "comfortey" food.
I love this restaurant. I try to get there anytime I travel to DC. Try the linguini with white wine sauce. Better than Mama's !

column4: 3000 K Street, NW Washington Harbour Washington, DC  20007
column13: Food was outstanding. I could tell it was good. However, the people there didn't look very happy working there, so it dampened the service rating significantly. And I mean every person there. And it wasn't very busy.
The best sushi I've had yet in DC. Unique and flavorful.
Farrah Olivia sits inside a windowless private dining room inside another restaurant by the same chef.
Excellent food. Service a little slow, but not too slow that its annoying. Chairs are oddly shaped so you have to check your coat. The pork loin was the best I've ever had. Rockfish is excellent.
I hate to say it but the food was just okay, especially for the price. The desserts = wonderful! The ambiance = romantic. The service = very good!

Despite the overall bad reviews from several other restaurant sites, I really wanted to see if it was as bad as many indicated. It was definitely NOT. The service was excellent and fast. The food was good and hot.

column4: Hilton Alexandria 5000 Seminary Rd. Alexandria, VA  22311
column13: Extremely mediocre food given that it was a christmas price fixe menu. Very disappointing for the price.

column4: ES Wahington DC 900 10th St. NW Washington, DC  20001
column13: Finn & Porter had a very nice ambience to it. The waiter we had was very courtesy and made a few nice suggestions on menu items. While the food was only moderately proportioned, it was very tasty.

Food was ok service was worse. Waited a good 5 minutes for hostess to appear so we could be seated. Then waited for a server. She didn't know what Bourbons they had and likely didn't know what Bourbon is. How can you work in a bar not at least know a few names of each type of liquor?
A top-notch dining experience as always.
Food was amazing! Lots of choices for those trying to "be good" and maybe a little "bad," too.
Great Brunch, the FrancoAmerican Burger is Epic with a side of Truffle Fries...

column4: 1960-A Chain Bridge Road Tysons Corner, VA  22102
column13: Dined for Restaurant Week. Had the ribeye steak, green beans and Fleming's potatoes. Food was very good, service was very good. Exceptional wine choices -- was able to find a good wine without breaking the bank.

column4: 675 Zachary Taylor Highway Flint Hill, VA  22627
column13: I found the dining room a bit too big and sterile for my liking. I saw a smaller back room and will ask to be seated there if we come again.
Great tasting food. Great wait staff.

column1: Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse - Washington DC
column13: I had not visited Fogo's in a few years because there are so many restaurants out here today, and we like to expand our horizon. However, it was my coworker's 60th birthday and we wanted to take her somewhere special. Four of us went to Fogo's for lunch. It was absolutely fabulous. From the service to the Mango cream dessert -- all were spectacular. I am glad we went because it was a reminder of what a great place this is. Everyone should try Fogo's at least once because this place is just absolutely fabulous. I'm going back next week for dinner.
Love love love this restaurant! Has been amazing for years.

We found Fotis over the summer and when we are in Culpeper usually stop by for lunch. This time however, we were a little disappointed. The food and service was very lack luster. I hope the next time we stop by we will have a better experience.

They called to re-confirm though I have not missed a single open table res AND they hid their number. They asked if anything else they could do. I mentioned guest was on a no salt diet and that I wanted a quieter spot. This was lost by the time I checked in with hostess who did no make eye contact. I sensed I was intruding on her chat which she continued while checking me in. True Chef Salad was really pathetic -- a few globs of meet, a cross-section of iceberg and some almost pickled hunks of vegetable with the apparent intent of a "rustic" arrangement on an elongated plate. Looked like someone was preparing to make a sandwich, and was in no hurry to return. Guest's fries were soggy in appearance/taste. Won't try to introduce to another

This Founding Farmers continues to suffer from uneven service quality. One week it can be a 4/5 and the next day a 1 or 2. Does not seem to be impacted significantly by how full the restaurant is. Also, the portion sizes are getting smaller. I have found the portion for the tomato soup, which is excellent, to be a lot smaller than when they first opened. Also, the small farmer's salad could now fit on a plate for a tea cup. Like the service, the size of the salad varies from week to week.

column1: Fourth Estate Restaurant at the National Press Club
column13: The crab cakes were amazing, as was the service. We were literally the only people in the restaurant, though. This place is defintely a little dated, but the staff couldn't have been nicer. I liked it and would go again.
The food and service were fine but the noise level the evening we dined was totally unacceptable. There was a large table of adults and children who were loud and obnoxious.
I like the Front Page. It has never disappointed and this visit was no exception. I think the service is GREAT and I really like their food. It is well worth a visit at either lunch or dinner.

I had a great time. Service with a smile. Great ribs. My only complaint is that the glass of Shiraz I had was from a bottle that had been open too long. I should have sent it back, but did not want to look like a snob since I was the only one at the bar drinking red wine. Perhaps that should have been a hint!
very tasty food and a little priceylimited wine list by the glass

column1: Fyve at The Ritz-Carlton Pentagon City
column13: We love the food and the waitress was wonderful and made our night memorable.
Delightful place with great service and food.

My husband and I were invited for dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday and this was Inauguration weekend. In addition, we had not been to Georgia Brown's in years because we were not that pleased so we were a little reluctant to go back. but since the group of 10 were all friends,we decided to give it another try. And I must admit, the entree, appetizer and drinks were just awesome. (Had no room for dessert). I totally enjoyed my meal of the shrimp stuffed with crab meat with mac & cheese on top of sauteed spinich. Yummm, Yumm.This dish I highly recommend. Service was great and no confusion with the tab! Thanks for a great experience.
A rare find for a restaurant located in a shopping center.
The food and setting always are outstanding. With two kids at home, we do not get out as often as we would like. When we go out to dinner, Geranios is one of our favorites.

Surprising given it looks like a typical strip mall hibachi joint. I sat at the sushi bar, where the service was not good. I was the only person in the restaurant - except for one other family - and it took forever for them to refill soda or even ask if I needed anything. But, for me, the food trumps all so I give it a very good review as the sushi was pretty good. Mostly mainstream offerings, but a few rolls were unique. Overall, I would go again for the sushi.
Exceptional Valentines Dinner, we will return next year.
Magnificent restaurant! My entire group was pleased and we all agreed to come back when it gets warm.
We had a window table with a great view. Very romantic atmosphere. The food and service was outstanding. I had the lamb and my wife had the crab cake. An enjoyable time!

Grand Cru was a delight and we very much enjoyed our first visit here last week. Excellent service, good food and great value for money. There's a very good selection of wines, starting under $20 and featuring just a couple of $400 bottles, mostly offered at prices similar to or below what you'd pay in a wine store. Corkage was just a few dollars. The atmosphere was relaxed. Service was friendly but efficient. We shared three small plates and two desserts and enjoyed them all. We'd love to become regulars -- but unfortunately we live 1,500 miles away.

The Grapeseed is a comfortable, unpretentious place for nice evening. The service is attentive and professional. The Cordell location is superior to the overly crowded Bethesda Row area. The Grapeseed is a nice place to meet friends/family and enjoy conversation. Thank you.

column1: Greenhouse at the Jefferson Hotel Washington DC
column13: I had a wonderful experience with a group of 5 girlfriends. This would be a perfect place for ladies brunch or Mother's Day. But it would also be lovely for couples too. The staff was great—very professional. We really felt like we were being taken care of.

column4: 659 Zachary Taylor Hwy Flint Hill, VA  22627
column13: We were beyond description with enjoyment as we received each course, delighted with flavor on the pallet, one could only wish for! The evening was everything we could have only wished for.
Great food and drinks, though drinks were small for the price.
Excellent on every level! Our servers made sure we had a very enjopyable time & we will definitely go back.

column4: 1200 New Hampshire Ave. NW Washington, DC  20036
column13: The highlight of the evening was the keylime pie. Everything else, including the pasta and fish was mediocre. Not bad but there's many other places around the same price point that are significantly better. Great location but we probably won't go here again.

After living downtown for several years this place is a welcome surprise! Cannot get over how much food you get for the money - double anything within 30 minutes of downtown! Mussels were good and plentiful, house brown bread was great, steak was cooked to perfection and yummy, and dessert cocktails were tasty and smooth. Nice amount of privacy and comfortable bar atmosphere, also looks like the have a nice area for larger groups that can become a curtained off "room" - noted for future events. :)

Good place for drinks but not so much for dinner/food. The queso fundido was not good. It was too thick. You needed a knife to cut through it. It tasted like they took polly o string cheese and melted it down. I do like that they used corn tortillas rather than flour. The tacos were decent as well as the pupusa's but the fajitas had no flavor.

We had an amazing time! The food was good and the ambiance was spectacular. The staff and service was absolutely friendly and attentive. The one thing me and my girlfriends noticed most was that the men were very energetic and never hesitated to ask us to dance... We will definiately make it a "girls-night-out" favorite spot.

My only complaint is the restaurant di not inform me in advance that they could not take care of my special request (two roses at the table). The manager indicated they did not have time to read the many requests for that day and they would not have wanted to express anything in front of my guest that would have been embarrassing. While the reasoning is novel, my guest arrived and was seated 5 to 7 minutes before I did, so it would have been nice to have known that the request was not beeing honored and that it was the policy of the restaurant. Thanks.
The dining was ok, if you are into an Irish resturant it doesnt have the ambuance. The bar section would be where you would like to go if i went again.

column4: Hilton McLean 7920 Jones Branch Drive McLean, VA  22102
column13: Best restaurant in area by far. Always discovering new favorites!

Good place to take a group for brunch, since they have tons of options for brunch food and "food food." It wasn't the best thing I've ever eaten, but it hit the spot. The number of choices for bloody marys and mimosas is amazing, so it's worth it just for that.

The food at Hill Country is phenomenal. The a la carte style menu is perfect for groups because everyone gets their own check. We went for dinner with a group of 7 and have a great table downstairs where all of us could sit, talk, and enjoy our meals, and then had a prime seat for live music. The performance set up was fantastic, very intimate with an upbeat vibe. My only complaint was the service. We saw our waitress, at most, twice the entire night, after waiting for 45 minutes, we finally canceled our last pitcher of beer and just asked for the check. She was slow and unavailable, and blamed the poor service on the bartenders, which we could see from our table was not the case. Thank goodness we only had to order drinks from her!
Had a light dinner of soup and sushi. All were very good.
We loved it. Small, great service and fine food. We'll be back.

The only thing that stopped me from giving 4 stars for service is that for some reason they insist on serving you all the food in items you're sharing rather than just leaving on the table. It's a bit much.
This was not the first time in this place for me! Other then very tight table we've had a great time and enjoyed the night!
Wonderful night for me and my guest.

column4: 5639 Stone Road Village Centre Shopping Centre Centreville, VA  20120
column13: Felt at home, but with better food.
Excellent service and good food.
i have been to Indique quite a few times. The food is always good, and service is always spotty. I keep coming back for the food!!!
First time at the restaurant and enjoyed it. The food was spicy and pretty good overall. Our waiter was good as well.

Was my birthday treat this year and the restaurant didn't disappoint - at least until the end. We had an adorable and romantic nook, but half way through our dinner a large and noisy group was paraded past us to the adjoining room. Just gotta love hearing wanna-be's comment about how cute we looked and how very romantic our table was - right in front of us as though we were part of the decor. The restaurant's large enough, and was empty enough, they could have put them anywhere else. Restaurants - sometimes the extra steps for your servers is worth the comfort of your diners. Dinner was delicious, but desert was a let-down.

The bar was nice and energetic, but sitting down for dinner was a mistake. We were seated in a corner which was nice because it was quieter, but the service was absolutely horrible (took for ever to meet our server, and once we did he didn't come back very often. That's especially bad since we were there for happy hour). The appetizer was good but the main entree was overcooked and even if it wasn't it wouldn't have been much better.

column1: The Irish Inn at Glen Echo
column13: I hadn't been to the Irish Inn at Glen Echo for a long time although it is in my neighborhood. Great spot for a quiet and tasty lunch. I will go again and look forward to the warm weather when we can sit on the deck.

If you like a spot so noisy that you and your server have to communicate in sign language, this is your kind of place. But noise is not its only selling point. Irish people must be the salt of the earth--or so the chef believes. The gravy on the bangers and mash (sausages and mashed potatoes) was so salty it was inedible. And when I shouted to the server that I would like some H-P sauce, a staple of Irish condiments, she said she had never seen any on the shelf and offered instead Tabasco! Irish pubs seem to be proliferating in Washington DC. Do yourself a favor and try one--a different one.
Good, but was not happy when they told my party that the table was booked at 7:30 that night, and my reservation was at 5:45, so beware you need to finish by 7:25????

column4: 962 Edwards Ferry Rd NE Leesburg, VA  20176
column13: good service but order wrong and the kitchen jacked up my steak and returned it and when we got it back all they did was take it off the plate and put new potatoes and beans. not a good steak to begin with. our server really tried to help but just wasnt good food.
Right in the heart of historic Frederick. Wonderful tapas!

column1: J&G Steakhouse at the W Hotel Washington DC
column13: The lunch at J & G was outstanding. We had 3 entrees: crab cake, grilled salmon, chopped salad. There was a Spanish red by the glass which was quite good. The service was very good but slow. We sat for 10 minutes before a waiter came. The wine order took 10 minutes to appear. I ordered the crab cake sandwich without bread and the waitress offered the dinner appetiser which was not on the lunch menu. It was perfect with a bright gingery sauce, grapefruit, avocado. The salmon was ordered no salt and it was cooked perfectly. Had my guests' travel arrangements been more cooperative the slow service would have been okay but due to an Amtrak snafu we were pressed for time. Special thanks to the W receptionist who arranged for a cab.
Great food. Service was wonderful!
The macaroni & cheese leaves much to be desired -- too oily and not enough "cheese-ness".
We had the Chef's special which is a parade of Tapas. We were too full to eat them all. Next time I will either come in starving or try to sample each plate instead of eating everything.

The food was not all that great and really pricey for a really small tapa plate. I expected better tasting food, especially with the good rating I read, but again I was definitely dissapointed. Parking is only validated for (1) hour nothing more, so you still end up paying for parking. As for seating it was instant, at least with a reservation. You definitely have to have an open mind to eat here as well as deap pockets if you want to feel remotely full.
Quite, private corner table on a rainy night for a delicious 5 course (restaurant week) meal! Great service, a real pre-theater treat.
we went on trivia night - it was a lot of fun and great food/service.

I like the quiet of early evening- makes it easy to talk. I had a blue cheese burger and fries- very good. My husband had a pasta dish he enjoyed. Plenty of parking, good service and friendly service. I would go back.
Great steaks....fillet was the best ever, chef did good.

column1: The John Marshall Tasting Experience at Oak Hill
column13: The cost for tasting only 4-5 wines per flight is too high. It is not worth the experience.

column4: 400 North Capitol Street NW Washington, DC  20001
column13: This is be best seafood restaurant in DC
Excellent food, great music! Perfect for romantic evenings or special occastions.
Whenever I meet clients in this neighborhood for a meal, Juniper is my go-to spot, as I can always rely on the service and quality.

Had lunch here with a friend. I had gotten their take-out lunch special before, but this was the first time that either of us went there for a sit-down meal. The baba ganouj appetizer was delicious -- nice smoky flavor, very eggplanty. I had the lamb sandwich; my friend got the portobello mushroom sandwich. Both were tasty, but my sandwich needed more meat. The way they roll their sandwiches is unique, but it means the pita bread can overwhelm the other ingredients, and you're left with only bread at the ends. They should cut the rolls in half, to make them easier to eat. Sandwiches came with hummus, and it was a lot of food. It wasn't very crowded, so it was quiet. Very good service. We didn't order any drinks, besides sparkling water.

The lamb was very good, but the other elements of the meal lacked flavor, the wine selection is limited and appears to have been chosen by someone who does not know wines, and the server lacked training. For example, she did not glance at the table when she went in or out of the dining room, therefore, missing signals requesting service. The table lay-out looks like a college dining hall.
Sushi is always delicious and the service is always great.

My first visit to Kellari, and I'll definitely go back. My meal was excellent and my dining companions seemed very happy with theirs as well. We shared an order of saganaki cheese, which was delicious. My prasini salad was excellent, as was my entree of grilled shrimp on a bed of wild mushroom risotto (Garides Corfu). There is an impressive display of fresh seafood on ice at the rear of the restaurant, so you know what you're getting. Ordered baklava for dessert, which included three generous slices...enough for two or three to share. Service was attentive and efficient. The space is very attractive and noise level low enough for easy conversation. A very fine dinner a happy discovery for future return visits.

My wife and I had a lovely date at Kenmore Inn. The atmosphere is a Pre-Civil war home that is immaculate. Its pretty small so its quiet and intimate. Our server was attentive and professional but the best part was the food. It was heavenly. The serving sizes were perfect and the plating was exquisite. The food itself (I had the Duck and my wife had the Filet Mignon) was well seasoned and cooked perfectly. We are rather picky with restaurants but this rates as one of the best in the area.

I can usually tolerate mediocre (even poor) service, but it was a little ridiculous that our waitress lost our order and had to come back to our table to ask for it again (probably fifteen minutes later, I might add). I really don't want to dwell on that. What I will focus on, however, is that the food was just subpar. Not bad. Just passionless. Come on, put a little elbow greece in that stuff guys--it wasn't a bad menu. Just try a little harder; I think it could go a long way in Kora's favor.
Every dish on their menu is full of savory flavor, from the chicken teriyaki roll to the small steak bites.

column4: 300 W. Broad Street Falls Church, VA  22046
column13: It is always a pleasure to come and eat at La Caraquena. The food is always wonderful and the service is great even when it is really busy.

Every dish that our party of four had, from appetizers to entrees to dessert, was utterly delicious. The beef stew was especially tasty, as was the sausage appetizer. We went for the DC Restaurant Week, during which the restaurant had a limited menu for $35 per person for dinner. It was a great deal for a great meal, and we would return to try the more expansive choices on the regular menu.

Traditional French food. While the restaurant cannot compete with the fancier restaurants of DC, La Cote D'Or is about the best food available in Falls Church. As an added benefit, the prices are not comparable to the fancier restaurants in DC. In summary, La Cote D'Or is very good French food at a reasonable price.

Nice restaurant, It is in Marth's Addition in Chevy Chase Maryland. Nice quiet street.Bistro like setting with a gas fireplace. Decent selection of wine,Food is above average but the ambiance and setting are what sets this place apart.Good for a quiet evening out, not "plush" by any means. Would repeat.

This is a great little spot for date night. The ambiance was sweet, the vibe was good but it wasn't too loud. The food was better than average, although the lambshank was a little greasy. The was not as attentive as I would have liked but it was packed and that is to be expected. Overall the food and service were better than average, and the ambiance was excellent.
The food was terrific, we got shrimp and steak fajitas.
Huge eclectic selection of tapas...cooked to perfection. Guarantee there is something on the menu for everyone. Outsanding and friendly service.

We sat on the middle floor for dinner. The hosts/hostesses running up and down the stairs shook the floor quite a bit. Other than that, it was a great dinner. I would definitely go back--but ask not to be seated on the second floor.

Just based on the quality of food, I'd put this food on the level of a chain restaurant like Outback, Applebee's or Ruby Tuesdays, but for Spanish tapas. The food is passable, but out of the 7 or 8 dishes I tried, only the more expensive dishes were good while everything else was cheap and mediocre at best. I don't totally condone going here, but know that this is not a "good" restaurant, just a fair to middling restaurant at a cheaper price, like you would find in a strip mall.

Took a party of 4 for lunch during restaurant week. All you can eat tapas for $20. Some dishes were particulary good, such as the bacon wrapped figs, croquettes and shrimp. Others were okay. Overally, this was a nice place and I would recommend.

We decided to try LacoMelza based on a review in the Post, boy are we glad we did! We had the Laco Bretmitad Tibs, Fish Kitfo, and Doro Wot, each was very good indeed but the fish dish was particularly good and refreshing. Their injera was very fresh and good. They have a vegan menu, which we did not try, but certainly will. The decor is delightful and cheery as was the service. The owner took a lot of time to explain dishes and their food philosophy. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed.
Piano music with dinner and absolutely superb service and loved the Dover Sole

The food was great but they ran out of almost everything on the menu and they still didn't let you substitute for different side dishes without a charge. The service was okay but the staff seemed a little rushed and chaotic. but the food was good

The food was outstanding but pricey. The wine was even pricier - $48 for a brand that retails for $15 or less. We only go there for special occasions due to the cost. There are other restaurants with excellent cuisine that are not as expensive.
Always good food and pleasant waiters. Never feel hurried.
One of the best live flamenco shows in the area and great food and service.
It continues to be the "go to" place for special occasions as well as for occasional meals. Food and service are consistently outstanding.

My wife and I have dined at L'Auberge Provencale on three different occasions and the food and service has always been beyond reproach. My hat is off to the Chief and the entire staff for making it an extremely enjoyable evening each and everytime!

Finally, an Italian-inspired restaurant on Barrack's Row that offers seriously fresh and imaginative food! It's terrific, especially the fresh pastas. Good wine list, attractive place. Parking can be beastly at night.

We ate here on the last day of restaurant week. The food was, as usual, very good (calf's liver, flounder, shirt steak pear pie and chocolate crepe). Only my appetizer, carrot and ginger veloute(which taste of neither carrots or ginger) but like a thin tomato soup.
Server recommendations were excellent!

I have never seen a more disorganized restaurant in my life. After waiting over 45 minutes past our reservation time for a table, we waited another 15 minutes for our drink order to be taken. Our appetizers arrived at our table after we were done with our very average entrees. And when those appetizers arrived, they were not what we ordered! When I asked for basic condiments from 4 different people including the manager, I finally had to go into the kitchen and get them myself.
OK, but nothing special. Too many other places that are better or more interesting to go back any time soon.

A tried and true favorite no matter the occasion! We continue to frequent both Lebanese Taverna in Bethesda, as well as in Rockville and Lebanese Taverna Cafe in Congressional plaza. The food is always great and the grafts of sangria keep getting better!
We had a wonderful dinner at the Lebanese Taverna. Great food and great service from a very attentive staff.

column4: 1840 International Drive Tysons Galleria McLean, VA  22102
column13: Great food but service was slow and forgot our orders a few times

It was a pleasant surprise to see the renovated Lebanese Taverna. It is spacious, and the s eating is reminiscent of Lebanon with the old stonework. Service from beginning to end was very friendly and helpful. There was a variety of menu items to fit most pocketbooks. The lamb shank, shrimp, and chicken fattouh were very nicely seasoned and the creme brûlée was very nicely done. A nice Bekka Valley Cabernet was enjoyed as well. We would definitely return.
Food was mediocre at best. Service was prompt (restaurant was pretty empty) but sort of casual. I brought an out-of-town guest, don't plan to return.
The tables are to close to each other so the seating is cramped and your conversation will be interupted by the conversation at the table next to you.

Great spot, did not know it was a fixed menu and then could not leave. I really wanted a different choice of food. This lack of flexibility means I will look elsewhere when wanting similar food. It was nice though.

Great food (bacon wrapped shrimp app, lamb shank, and short rib). Our server was terrific, knew when to be there and when to leave us alone. Everyone there was incredibly nice, from the host to the bartenders to even the bussers. I will absolutely be back.
Always a pleasure to dine here! It's a very well run establishment that hits high notes on food and service in a caual setting.
I went for the Kalik beer, but the food was great. Probably a little too nice for my simple tastes, but great food!

My family and I have been enjoying Lightfoot for many years! As a child I was truly mesmerized by its unique decor. It always made me think of house on haunted hill with that magnificent grand fire place and the beautifully detailed staircase leading you up into a separate dinning area. Now as an adult the magic is still there along with the fantastic menu that has something for everyone. I highly recommend Lightfoot to anyone, it's casual enough for a nice lunch at the bar, great outdoor patio set up during the warmer months and always a good choice for a romantic dinner for two or a family get-together! And don't forget their fried green tomatoes, they are to die for!!!
Visited with my friend and her two kids. Staff was very attentive. Food was excellent. We had a wonderful time.
Amazing little dishes. It's very loud even if no one is there. Our server was efficient but awkward.

My friends and I had a reservation at Logan's during restaurant week. Half of my party was late and they were nice enough to hold our table for 30 min for us. We were allowed to order anything off the menu for restaurant week with minimal extra fees added on. Most of the girls at my table ordered steak with mushrooms and they all enjoyed it. For starters I had the brussel sprouts, we also ordered the oysters and calamari. All of the starters were great and fit for 1-2 people. For the main entree I ordered the veggie pasta and didn't like the flavoring. I was also disappointed that the dish was the only veggie option for an entree. The desserts were limited by the time we had ordered. But we all recommend the health cheesecake.
Delicious Mexican brunch. Really great, fresh chips and salsa. The tamalito dulce was very tasty, as were the huevos rancheros.
Great restaurant! Service was wonderful! Will be sure to go back again soon! Manager got me another portion of brocollini when it arrived too spicy without my knowledge of it! :)
Yummy, but pricey. Kinda cheap that you have to "request" the complementary bread
Everything was just perfect! I proposed to my girlfriend and the staff made everything just right. She never expected a thing.

Went for Sunday brunch after reading the great reviews on here. And I was pleased! It wasn't crowded at all that day as people usually said it was. Perhaps because it was Super Bowl Sunday, and most were getting ready to attend other functions later. The staff was very nice and pleasant when I arrived. I was waiting on a friend that was running late, and chose to sit at the bar until she arrived. The server asked me if I would like to start my mimosas now. I thought that was nice. The lady playing on the piano was funny and entertaining. Brunch was GREAT! So much for a good price! It felt like a steal. :) I would definitely come back again.
A good spot to meet friends, loud but friendly.
Service was nit good. Food took 45 min to arrive!

column4: 2001 International Drive Tyson's Galleria II McLean, VA  22102
column13: Maggiano's has very good food and portions sizes for the money. At this location, the service was average and the wait times from the kitchen were a little slow, but not as bad as our last visit.

We came during the off time after 2PM. Only one server was on staff and she was nice but slow. The bartender and bar service was superior and the chef allowed us to order from their dinner menu before the scheduled hour, nice touch and good food. I would go back to the Majestic.
Great Asian food, delectable spicy and non spicy sauces to personalize your hot pot experience.

We were attending a gallery event at DC Arts in Adams Morgan and after some interesting mural sightings went in for a leisurely Sunday dinner. Located on a quiet residential street it has astonishingly beautiful decor, elegant old world ambiance and we were warmly greeted and seated by the maitre-d'. The food- kebabs all the way- kubideh and chicken- were generously portioned and well served. This place has an interesting story with great connections for history buffs- a fine dining experience and a DC landmark too! Well recommended.
Try going here when the college kids are away for a long weekend or holiday for best results.

Everything worked out fine because our reservation was fairly early but when we got there they didn't seem to have the reservation which kind of surprised me after having tried your service for the first time......so maybe next time I need to try to make a reservation sooner or maybe they did have it but the hostess didn't seem to give the impression that the restaurant did!!
If you like Korean food you need to try it. I like this restaurant a lot.

This is a small restaurant, with a really friendly staff. There really isn't a good place to wait to be seated. We were about 15 minutes early for our reservation, and waited almost half an hour to be seated. The manager apologized for the wait, saying several reservations came in about the time ours did. He offered us a complimentary dessert and coffees/teas. We really enjoyed the evening. The food was real Italian, and the staff as accommodating as they could be.
The Manor House is an excellent dinIng experience. Every visit has been exceptional on every level.
seafood special was so salty i could not eat it. bread rolls tasteless. salad boring. bar had a live band so loud could not talk/hear in ding area
My wife and I have been to Marcel's a dozen times over the years. Each time the experince is better than the last.
We really enjoyed out time here at the restaurant. The food was GREAT, Service was excellent. Will go again.

The Sunday Brunch at Market Street Grill is great. However, if you're a Restaurant.Com member, please note that you cannot use your vouchers for Sunday Brunch! This, despite the fact that "brunch" is listed on the MSG Restaurant.Com web page. The servers are great and are quick to keep the mimosas flowing. Tip: Get your brunch entree "to go" and plan to eat it for dinner and feast from the abundant buffet of shrimp, sushi, fresh fruit and veggies, and your usual breakfast items while at the restaurant. The hostess can cop a little attitude if you don't have a reservation, so make one if you can. Also note- if your party contains only women, they will try to give you a bad table in an undesirable location.

Had a great second dinner at Masa 14. Since it was a holiday, we forgave the 40 minute wait for our reservation. Once we sat down, everything went smoothly. The menu options were great- lots of different flavors. Everything was served beautifully, at an appropriate temperature. Our waiter was helpful (and he seemed to be covering the entire upstairs area himself- impressive!)

I have been hearing bout Masala Art for quite some time now and even found myself recommending it to people before I even tried it myself! The sad news is that we finally got there (yes, on Vday..), it took us 25 minutes to get a waiter's attention - despite having a reservation. Then there was the food - which we ordered a lot of to try various dishes. I have never tasted something that was so salty, spicy and yet completely flavorless (was very strange). I'm hoping they just had a really off night...

I love the food and wine selections here, but our service was awful this time. After we were seated, it took the server 20 minutes to even come see us and then they messed up our salad orders. You'd think with all that hassle, they'd offer complimentary desserts or a discount on our bill, but nothing beyond a simple "sorry" was offered. When you delay people's meals by over half an hour, I expect a little more.
All in all we had a great experience. The service was slow, but as usual Matchbox was super busy so I guess that is to be expected. The food was worth the trip!

I enjoyed the mini burger appetizer as well as the delicious pizza! The manager was kind enough to tell us that our pizza accidently split in half in the oven and apologized. He said that it'll be a bit longer and I appreciate the honesty.

We had a lovely family brunch at Matisse. A great place to gather and the food was outstanding. Fabulous beignets, eggs Chesapeake and french toast. They were flexible about adding more people to my reservation and even changing the time at the last weekend.
Food and service was both very good. Made for a great start to New Year's Eve.
Good sushi with a very casual ambiance. The staff and sushi chefs are quite friendly and actually are Japanese! The sushi and sashimi are well prepared and tasty. Enough to return for more.
Wonderful service and great food for a lovely going away party.

BIG DELAY between appetizer and dinner entrees for an after 8 pm dinner reservation. Restaurant was not full. Our Food sat under warmer for long time because the lemons were all dried out. Manager was apologetic, but was just going thru the motions to appease.

My wife and I wanted to compare the location in Washington DC with the one in the National Harbor. We try to celebrate our wedding anniversaries with M & S and we have been extremely satisfied with the service at both location. We would certainly reccomend either location for a great experience.
Lobster was overcooked; restaurant comped the meal

column1: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Washington DC (F Street)
column13: Great food. Service was just ok - slow getting drinks even though restaurant was pretty empty. We had a group of 9 so this was a great place to go that was not crowded and had plenty of large tables.

column1: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Washington DC (K Street)
column13: Outstanding service, great menu and food.

My husband and I enjoyed our evening at McLoone's and our server was great! The reason for the 2 stars? I ordered the pork chop dinner, sides were scrumptious and I am sure my chop would have been also if it wasn't so tough! As I tried cutting it, the plate kept sliding across the table, so it was hard to enjoy. I should have gotten the salmon.... However, everything else was on point!

We had a fun evening and were happy with the service and the ambiance. We had a fairly large group (9 people) and they were very accomodating. The only drawback is the food, which is decent but not great by any means. This would be a perfect restaurant if they could improve the food. I love middle eastern food and am really not overly picky, but was under-impressed with some basics such as the hummus, and really unhappy, because of the price, with the sea bass. But I'll go back and it another try just because of the atmosphere.

column4: 10123 Colvin Run Road Great Falls, VA  22066
column13: We have eaten here several times and the food is always tasty. The service is a little less consistent but overal it is a good choice for a night out.
Great experience! We loved the food, service, people, and environment!
